title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Casual interview with PI. Very friendly. They ask about your likes and interest, culture fit is important. Very willing to help. Time commitment is also important. Most of the research in wet lab is on-site, not remote.
Interview Questions: Describe to me a field of science you have a passion in.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I found a lab in which I was interested working and contacted that professor that interviewed me just asking questions about my background, my interests and my courses. I was also asked if i was eventually interested in getting a phd
Interview Questions: General questions about background and interests

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Telephonic - had a basic interview and understood responsibilities of job role managerial - 1 - manager 1 took the interview Managerial - 2 - this was the tough round where i was asked a lot of questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself projects team based questions previous experience questions

title: Building Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Simple, straightforward. Asks you mostly about how you will perform the job and different scenarios. Short interview as well at least for mine. You have to take a test and pass in order to get an interview. They have a registry that they go by
Interview Questions: Tell Me About Yourself? How are you going to handle this type of situation?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds 1st round behavioral questions. They want to learn about your personality as the majority of time, you will work in a team and are often likely to assist their stakeholders. 2nd they are asking questions that are technical. Understanding of SQL and Python is required.
Interview Questions: How to describe yourself working as a team player?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Informal, easy, personable . The interviewers were the managers and charge nurse. They really just wanted to know why the ED and past work history and experiences. They were lovely people.
Interview Questions: W/hat is the reason you are making the transition to the ER

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: easy smooth process with very little to no hassle. Very professional. competitive pay. many ways to increase hourly. good benefits. very informative. hired on the spot, with a very quick start date.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose UIC?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: My Interview was over zoom with multiple faculty in the program I was applying for. They were personable and professional. They responded via email personally to let me know their answer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RN, Hospital Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: i had to submit resume online and then phone screening followed by office of HR who scheduled and followed up by an in person interview and then after interview call with offer
Interview Questions: what is my population of interest

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Good! You learned what they focus on and what they care about. I even start interviewing people who are interested in the job. I really enjoy the work and the experience
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Program Student Advisor (Recruiting Coordinator) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Recently, I was suppose to have a phone interview for a position. However, during the allotted time I never received my call or change of status regarding my application. Upon emailing someone in HR, as I could find no contact information elsewhere, I was told the position was filled. While I'm glad the position was filled I was upset to see it how it has been handled for myself and other possible candidates.
Interview Questions: Unfortunately, I have no idea.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: ou have been identified as a potential candidate for the Program Administration Manager position. My name is Vanessa and I am the Program Coordinator for the Osher Center for Integrative Health.
Interview Questions: How old are you really?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Simple and straightforward, I felt that they asked important questions and made sure I knew the details of the job. Overall I would say it was a good experience, I was prepared and satisfied
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you had to problem solve

title: Museum Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions:
Multiple Rounds of in-person interviews (Pre-pandemic) 
Be prepared to talk about public speaking and program development skills. However with a new executive director, interview process may have changes in this department
Interview Questions: Bring an object you can explain and use as a teaching tool.

title: Director Revenue Cycle Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. Someone from HR calls to arrange the (remote) interview. Confirmation emails tell you how to log in (standard post-pandemic remote process). Interview itself was pleasant, fairly introductory on both sides. I was told interviews were continuing for about a week then I would hear about next step. It's been three, so I get the point, but follow up emails were ghosted.
Interview Questions: Tell me about each of the different positions you've held.

title: Fitness Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: The interview was simple. You are required to share your availability to work as it is a part time job. You may also be required to lift up to 50 lbs to rerack weights and clean equipment.
Interview Questions:
How are your availability within the week? 

Are you able to work weekends and late nights?

title: Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Just talked to the manager about my experiences. Got to chat one on one and get to know each other. Walked through the expectations of the job role. Discussed what events that campus tour guide work
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tour guide?

title: Architectural Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: First interview meeting with related departments followed by a second interview meeting with directors of the department and branches where a set of questions were asked in turns on zoom.
Interview Questions: How are you working remotely?

title: Research Assitant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very simple over-the-phone interview process. Received confirmation of acceptance several days later by phone call as well. Simple questions about general interests and qualifications were asked and quickly verified. Overall, a pretty smooth hiring experience
Interview Questions: What are your qualifications related to this job?

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: After the application. If you are good fit for the position. You just need to complete some paperwork. You must send a list of courses which you enrolled and your schedule for the upcoming semester.
Interview Questions: Your schedule for upcoming semester.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Everyone I met with was kind, courteous, and professional during the interview process. It was a half-day interview lasting 4 hours. They told me that they would be reaching out to let me know within a week; when I hadn't heard from them a month later, I reached out and was told that I was not being offered the job.
Interview Questions: What is your general conflict resolution style

title: Clinical Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: This interview process was very quick and efficient. Loved everyone I met. Too many steps though. I wish it was fewer rounds so you don't answer the same questions every time.
Interview Questions: What do I dislike about data management

title: Public Information Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I met with the director and HR rep privately in an office. The director overviewed the position. Then I went into the conference room and interviewed with the entire team. They read questions off their sheet. I then took a tour of campus. It lasted about 2.5 hours.
Interview Questions: What software programs am I familiar with

title: Admitting Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: The process is such a headache. You test for these positions and go through two interviews and not hear back for months on positions they want to fill "ASAP" You can have a perfect score but unless you know someone leveling up is pretty much off the table here.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this department?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I appliesd, was contacted by HR though email about 2 weeks after application for an interview with a hiring committee. A week later I did a second interview with the direct supervisor of the position. Both interviews were on zoom. A month passed and I never heard anything else from them.
Interview Questions: How do you handle feedback from peers and supervisors.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite smooth. People here were really nice an friendly. It would have been a great place to work for and a great place to grow professionally.
Interview Questions: questions about my field experience

title: Monitoring and Reseasrch Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process happened over zoom, it was very relaxing and engaging. A panel of 3 interviews with diverse experiences. I enjoyed interviewing with the team > Heard back in about a week
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good fit for this role ?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Principal Researcher, looking through resume to analyze my qualities. Sharing information about myself, previous experience, and career goals. Asked if there were any questions regarding the position. Mentioned how it was an unpaid internship.
Interview Questions: Why are you passionate about research?

title: Online Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Mixed group interview with about eight other candidates and three interviewers. Received feedback from interviewers within one week of interview. Point of emphasis on requirement to have flexible schedule to take on job role.
Interview Questions: What past experience do you have with tutoring?

title: Computer Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard behavioral and technological interview. They asked me about my experience with remote desktop, building computers, and troubleshooting an internet connection. They also asked about my experience with coding.
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone is asking for help but a classroom is asking for help at the same time?

title: Grauduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Take home assessment with a full stack web application development. Gave the tech stack as Django backend as that is what is needed. I was given the freedom to choose any front end framework and language. You are given a week to work on this task and then present your findings and give a demo.
Interview Questions: They asked about my past experiences

title: CRC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a zoom interview with 7 members from the Clinical research team. They asked interview related questions, some typical questions about future goals. They asked questions like how would you handle a study or what would you do if you were given a job at last minute. Best to look up interview related questions and answer them to the best of your ability.
Interview Questions: What previous experience do you have?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: It was a short interview with a test about AutoCAD and reading Architectural drawings like how to find the scale of a drawing, the north side of the project, etc...
Interview Questions: AutoCAD questions like how to group, make blocks, layers

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Only one person on a phone screening - no peer review of questioning or outside input. Felt like gate keeping and only had 15 min to answer 5 in depth questions.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work at the College of Medicine?
How would serve the diverse needs of a medical school student?

title: Associate Director, Career Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: I met with 3 representatives from different departments. They reviewed my experience and qualifications. We also discussed the new position I was interviewing for, its demands and expectations. The team was very positive, open, and communicated each step of the process.
Interview Questions: How do you use data to drive decisions in your field?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: WE were brought into a room and asked to attend a meeting. After the process, we were then told to go into separate meetings with someone. They ask you questions and they will hire you based on the responses.
Interview Questions: Why did i want to do this

title: Math Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were really nice and comprised of the program head and a calculus professor. They asked questions about the process to help out students and then asked to go through a calculus 2 problem and explain it.
Interview Questions: They asked me to solve the integral of ln(x)

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: supervisor interviews. ask human behavior questions. what is your future plan. how to deal with difficult time or situation. describe the detail. it is not easy if english is your second language
Interview Questions: human behavior. case by case

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
After applying,  one round of interviews. Mostly 5-10 behavioural questions. It takes about 30-40 mins.
Q. tell me about an achievement?
Q. A time when you failed and learnt?
Q. What are you proud you?
Few questions about blackboard and asked for suggestions of improvements in BB as a student
Interview Questions:
Q. tell me about an achievement?
Q. A time when you failed and learnt?
Q. What are you proud you?

title: GPPA Medicine Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Nerve-wracking but unlike any other interview I had. Rather than asking the simple why do you want to be a doctor, we went through things like a support system, least favorite class, emotional awareness. etc.
Interview Questions: What is something you will risk or struggle with in your undergrad?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: They ask you to describe previous research, what your career goals are, and they introduce you to what they do in their lab and their students.  This is repeated a couple times with a couple different professors to give you an idea of the range of research topics and background.
Interview Questions: Describe your research goal and the outcome

title: Computer Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Set up a group-interview with a 3 staff members. I was instructed to set up the laptop to the HDMI and projector. It was a mix of questions and skills demonstration.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to set up a printer manually? Can you demonstrate how to find the device's IP and MAC address? Have you imaged computers before, if so, how?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: I sent in resume. This was followed by an email to arrange a phone interview. After the phone interview, there was an interview with a panel. I was notified of their decision shortly after.
Interview Questions: What is your philosophy of urban education ?

title: Visiting Commercialization Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
It took some time for paperwork to get processed.
But overall, the whole interview process was pleasant and smooth. It was a fairly casual interview, and I was asked fewer technical questions during the interview. I got a chance to interact with everyone at the interview and asked questions to learn about the job duties and office cultures at UIC.
Interview Questions:
Why did you choose UIC?
Why technology transfer?
What could be a potential hardship/problem at the office?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Easy and simple. Questions are straight forward. Background and drug test required. Usually only one or two meetings. Offered within a week or two. Benefits start right away. Not difficult.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous work history?

title: Supply Chain Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Harvey, IL) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: I have had the phone interview pretty simple nothing hard. Asked if I was ok with the starting pay and am I familiar with Microsoft and Oracle  overall the interview was easy
Interview Questions: If the pay was ok with me

title: Doctoral Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Easy, straightforward process. You have to connect with individual departments and then typically end up being paid by the Graduate College. Everyone was highly professional and kind. Just be sure to show up on time and be passionate about your research.
Interview Questions: What got you interested in your research topic?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Easy process. But i guess depends on the interviewer and your job position. Everyone at UIC is super nice and helpful. Working here is great! I feel grateful to be working here.
Interview Questions: Previous experience and current relevant interests.

title: Facilities Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy, a lot of questions to get to know you better as a person and as a professional. Very conversational interview just be yourself and you'll be fine. I would just look over basic behavioral questions and fresh yourself on your achievements.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me about a time you failed on something and how you overcame this failure

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Most of the questions were asked from CV.
Prepare for all the languages which are mentioned in the job description.
The interview took place for 30 min to 1 hr.
Only one round was conducted and I received offer letter.
Interview Questions: Tell me about what specific contributions you made in all of the projects?

title: Medical Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Each Department does them a little diffrently but you will meet with program directors, Department head, and person who is currently doing the job you are interviewing for. It is difficult to get interview so typically if you have enough experience and fit office culture, you will fit it. It is very transparent and you hear back within weeks.
Interview Questions: What do you know about this role?

title: Marketing Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: The team of interviewers are amazing and polite. A lot of interviews before a decision is made as to whom they will hire. The 1st interview is a survey. The 2nd is over the phone. The 3rd is in person. I am not sure what the next step is as I have not had my 3rd interview yet.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you made a mistake and how did you go about correcting it.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: One interview with the primary coordinator (usual questions like "walk me through your resume", behavioral questions) and she presented the structure of the organization. Then a second group interview with 5 other people in the department, 20 minute questions, you give a 10-20 minute presentation on a research protocol they sent you, 10 minute patient role play. Last interview with the head of the institute.
Interview Questions:
What experience patient-facing experience do you have? 
What is one thing in a previous role you had you would change? 
How would you improve participant attrition?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions and behavioral interview questions. First a phone interview and then an in person interview with many different staff members both internal to the department and external. Then one on one with the director.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you worked in a team.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with direct boss and her boss, resumé discussion, discussion of duties, expectations. It was simple and straightforward, and included introductions to people around the office as well. Walked around the office, discussed career goals.
Interview Questions:
Q: What would you like to get out of this position?
Q: What are you long-term goals?

title: Center Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: In-depth, detailed, specifics orientated, took about 2 weeks from start to finish. Overall, pretty average experience. The interviewer was professional and approachable. Would recommend to interview and would look for an opportunity at UIC again.
Interview Questions: Knowledge of Federal Contracting procedures

title: COMMUNITY OUTREACH SPECIALIST/WORKSHOP FACILITATOR/JOB SPECIALIST Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and helpful process. The interviewers were quite interested in all network and personal development skills and in the management and organization of data sets. All to be expected.
Interview Questions: Organization, communication, abilities to deal with many kinds of people.

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was rushed. The manager of the Epic IS department reached out to me and first I interviewed with her then 2 days later I had a meeting with the entire team on a webex meeting. She (manager) was very rushed and disorganized. After those two interviews I never heard from them again. I even followed back with an email. It was very rude and off putting experience.
Interview Questions: My certifications, salary expectations, and general interview questions

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions:
1, there are two rounds : 
Before interview, we are required to submit our resume through email and some course information as well as grading, GPA information
First round - an telephone interview
Second round - in-person interview with professors and HR staff
Interview Questions: Have you ever used xx programming language and tell about some projects you have done

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions:
Asked about range of past experience and research done in the computer science field as a student/employee, or asked about tasks/projects completed. 

After completing the course there is a possibility to enroll in the publishing research papers where the projects are tested against real-life scenarios. At this interview, the project lead investigator and PhD fellow who are members of the project were present.
Interview Questions: Programming proficiency was asked

title: Computer Science Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Easy. All you had to do was sign up and wait a month then check to see if you were chosen or not. Then you have to submit your information to the work office so that you can start working for the semester.
Interview Questions: Classes taken?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: It was a straightforward interview. You should just know the basic epidemiological techniques to do the job. You need to apply online and a specific recruiter will call you to discuss the job further.
Interview Questions: Explain about logistic regression?  What is the advantage of  it?

title: Academic Professional - College of Medicine Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Impromptu phone interview with division head leading to an in-person half day of interviews.  Job offer took a long time due to diversity initiatives. Was offered a job on the spot.
Interview Questions:
What are you looking for? 
A few tell me about a time when kind of questions.

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview. We sat around a table and discussed the position. It was a work study position for students. All of us who answered the questions and showed on time were given the job.
Interview Questions: Have you worked remotely and how do you manage your time at work?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Overall process took about 2 weeks between scheduling, interviewing, and waiting to hear back. Had both a one on one interview with the chief, and then a group panel with 3 people.
Interview Questions: Tell us why we should hire you for this position.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Application for graduate school. I received an offer of admission for the PhD program and then a few months later I received an offer for a teaching assistant at the department of electrical and computer engineering.
Interview Questions: Regular application for graduate school.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone call interview for about 30 minutes.  They ask about the past experiments you have and describe the job at the University of Illinois at Chicago.
Interview Questions: what's the skilled do you have?

title: Library Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: General questions about library workflow like classification systems and microsoft office along with some other personality questions about how to handle coworker relationships and stuff, simple math problems for testing if the candidate is a careful person
Interview Questions: how does congress classification system work

title: Math TA/Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. As long as you have good grades in math and have soft skills, you should be good. They don't ask you a lot of technical questions, just experiences and behavioral questions.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your experiences of teaching/tutoring. 
How would you answer when a student asks you a question that you are not very sure of? 
Can you communicate well?

title: Usher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Standard behavioural interview with a supervisor who would talk about college life and campus involvement. They make sure about you having ample amount of time for their shifts but are also flexible. It's a basic interview no pressure at all.
Interview Questions: Have you worked on-campus before? if yes please share your experiences and if they resonate with a position of an Usher

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Revolved around skype call where the boss asked about one's personal work strategy as well as problem solving skills. Also asked how one worked on team's and if they liked team environment.
Interview Questions: Do you work well on teams?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Joliet, IL) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was about 2:30 hours. I only met one person and I had to show my skills so she could see that I’m capable to do the job. then we did a tour.
Interview Questions: How much do you want to earn?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application online for the Clinical Research Coordinator position, and I was contacted by the principal investigator for an hour-long Skype interview with the PI.  The PI asked questions about my current position and other relevant research experience, but most of the interview consisted of the PI explaining the nature of the study and job duties.  The PI also gave me a chance to ask questions about the PI's study and research focus.
Interview Questions: What experiences have you had with managing high-risk participants?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward; met with 3 different people, standard interview questions. Started out first with the unit manager but he was inept and doesn't know how to interview so it turned out to be more of a chat. Then met with 2 RNs who were very nice and asked me a handful of standard questions you can find online.
Interview Questions: Name a time you has a conflict and what you did.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview for about thirty minutes. Then, on-site interview for about 1-2 hours. Met a supervisor and a head of the department. Got verbal offer at the end of the on-site interview. Offer letter a week later.
Interview Questions: Coding skills

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Was not contacted after applying in January, not even for a phone screen. Received an email 5 months later apologizing for the delay in follow-up and that they had already concluded interviews and hiring. I knew that the hiring process in higher education was notoriously slow, but yikes!
Interview Questions: Never contacted to interview

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for several openings and was called within days to set up two different interviews, once the interviews were set up I met with the lead MA and the person who would be my manager.
Interview Questions: What is one way you deal with conflict?

title: Computer Aid Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: The process consisted of two interviews. One with soft questions and the other was a technical interview. Soft questions asked about general interview questions such as my background and personality and the technical interview was solving a given problem.
Interview Questions: How does your background allow you to excel at this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly, asked open ended questions and seemed interested in knowing me. Discussed job position in detail and what day to day would look like. Talked about the work culture and atmosphere
Interview Questions: What I expected from the job.

title: Publicity-Promotions Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job in early December and received an email about a phone interview, which was really a ten minute phone screen, on 1/16. Had the phone screen on 1/23 and was emailed two days later on 1/25 about an in-person interview. Had in-person interview 2/6 and then did not hear anything for over 2 weeks. Finally received an email that I was not selected on 3/5.
Interview Questions: How do you work with others who are not interested in the work you are trying to do?

title: Publicity-Promotions Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied through UIC's website and had to wait a month or so before hearing back from the central HR office.  There was a zoom meeting with the two supervisors I would have, and then an in-person meeting after that.  Then, a week after I interviewed, I received an offer. The whole process was very fair, though it did take three months from my application date to my start date, so it did take some time.
Interview Questions: Q: If you were hired to the publicity promotions specialist role, what would your marketing campaign look like?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: I gave a talk about my work, then met individually with each lab member and the PI. I also had lunch with members of the lab. The interview started in the morning and ended in the evening. The classical post doc interview.
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in the lab?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Corresponded briefly via email to discuss interview date and time. The interview was conducted in person and was fairly basic, just a "get to know you better" type interview. What are your interests, why have you chosen your major, etc.
Interview Questions: What do you do in your free time?

title: Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was run by a search firm. The search firm organized the process and prepared me for the interview.  It went very smoothly.  The interview was held off site at an airport hotel.  It was very confidential.
Interview Questions: What is your vision?

title: Laboratory Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Found the lab on the uic website. Emailed the professor who ran it and she said she needed an engineer with a background in physics and programming. No real interview, just a rundown of the classes I have taken and a letter from one of my professors.
Interview Questions: What programming classes have you taken?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: You submit a resume, if selected they will call you for an in-person interview, clear that and you get the job. But the preference for the initial call will be given to employee referrals.
Interview Questions: Tell me about Yourself?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the position and didn't get a phone call until about 2 months later. They set up a phone interview since I live in another state. The interview was held by two floor nurses.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time something was changed that you originally did not like, but eventually agreed with.

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call from the student employment office a few days after submitting my job application and resume. Very quick and straightforward interview. Was basically asked about prior work experience and my class schedule/availability.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your prior work experience

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (University, IL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview and I thought it went well. I did not get the job. They selected someone else.  I met with all the assistant managers and the director also.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work there?

title: AAAN Peer Success Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The directors of ACE and AAAN interviewed me at the same time. They asked a varied of questions pertaining to my work experience and situational scenarios. I had to complete an application which required a 3.2 GPA, transcript, and 1 or 2 letters of recommendation.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your yourself.
Why would you be a good fit for this role?

title: Web Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was good.  It was for 3 rounds. 
First round: Initial phone call 
Second round: Technical 
Third round: Technical + HR questions

Overall the experience was good. Its recommended to have some kind of portfolio/work/website to demonstrate previous work
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and previous experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview: discussion with director of graduate studies

On site: Meeting with different faculty members; presentation in department; meeting with students within the department; meeting with department head; meeting with director of graduate studies; dinner interview at local restaurant
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer contacted me via email to ask if I was available for full-time work, then scheduled an in-person interview with me for the following week. It was a quick 30- maybe 45-minute interview total.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 5 years down the line?

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and then received an email from the laboratory to set up a Skype interview for later that week. It went well, and ended with the PI saying they would follow-up with me the next day for another round of interviews with other lab members. I followed-up, didn't hear back, followed-up again, and was told they selected someone else- not ideal communication. This will of course vary a lot based on the PI.
Interview Questions: What was my research background? Was I willing to work night/weekend hours?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Behavioral questions on how to approach and solve certain problems or difficult situations. 
Interviewers were professional and welcoming. Make sure to greet the receptionist and be nice to anyone you encounter. Also, make sure to ask questions and ask the interviewers about their experience with UIC.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and background

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: met with the lab PI, and then I went over to his office after setting up a specific day in which I would have had to start working.  I started working with other laboratory students that were working on their masters thesis.
Interview Questions: What is your study area?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions:
1. Applied online. Did not have any referral
2. Got interview call. Had just one round
3. 60 minutes interview, 4 interviewers
4.  Why do you want this job? Strength? weakness? 
5. Question on work samples
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a very quick process. I applied for the position, about 1-2 weeks later received an email for an interview. I interviewed, which took about 45 minutes. The next day I received a call that I got the job. However, I'm sure it is different for every department.
Interview Questions: Basic behavior/situational questions.

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is similar to that of other faculty job, however, there is no teaching requirement, a lot of research questions on previous, current and future research, meeting with at least 6 committee members
Interview Questions: What are two of your future funding application topics?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing for the University took almost a month. There was a phone screen first and then an in person interview. Was simple with basic interview questions.  Once hired I had to attend a 1 day orientation.
Interview Questions: What is your skill level with Adobe Creative Suite

title: Police Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: First round of interviews was scenario based. You were given scenarios beforehand, They spoke to ethics and such. Second set of interviews was about yourself ie flaws/strengths times you performed under stress are good to mention here
Interview Questions: Receiving Gifts/reporting them and ethics related questions

title: Research and Scientific Aid II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was just a general talk of what I suppose to do and how I have to work there. I explain about what I have done in past. Explained my experience of research work.
Interview Questions: Time availability, experience.

title: Library Access Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: basic questions. there are usually two or more people who will take the interview. be positive and don't forget to smile. they look for a friendly person who has good costumer care skills
Interview Questions: what are your skills? or qualities. tell us at least five`

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews stress-free. The first interview was with the head of the department and the second was with HR and it did not take long. Very professional environment, as you can expect from an educational institution
Interview Questions: I did not encounter any questions that were difficult.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was simple and easy to clear the interview. All were direct questions and not tricky. It went for an hour and it worked for me at last. The interview was asking me where I was from, why  I need this position, How despirate I am for this position.
Interview Questions: How do you think you suit this job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very short, lasting less than a week between submitting my resume and application to the interview and accepting an offer. The interview was in a MPH professors office and was rather casual -- we talked about my background, the available position, and the ways the two overlapped.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position?

title: Computer Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I have applied for the job in STS. I got a call from the interviewer for the dates. I have given my availability and Went for the interview. There were two persons who interviewed me.
Interview Questions: How to troubleshoot computer issues, internet issues, shared drives, VPN and email migrations.

title: General Office Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: My first round of interview was with HR, where they wanted to access my skills and overall energy of me. When asked about my overall interest and field of study is.
Interview Questions: Are you able to work in a fast-paced environment?

title: Security Guard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: We only had 10 minutes MAX for the interview so the questions were, what I would call, “normal interview questions”. Asking a lot about how you adjust to changes in the workplace. So be prepared for some rather “rough” and intimadating faces.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Extra Help Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied with my CV on UICs job posting site. I received an email a few weeks later and scheduled an interview. The interview was pretty straight forward. They asked about my skills and research interests. We all seemed to get along so it was a good fit as it was a small team.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my interest in the ongoing research in the lab.

title: Sales Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: It was smooth and easy spoke about the different products that were being sold also spoke about past job and coursework. Overall a good experience but took long to get back. need constant followup
Interview Questions: difference between ram and Harddisk

title: Nurse Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Lengthy
Usually a panel of management 
Questions and scenarios
Be specific about your work history and your experience with special needs children and adults 
Be open and honest
Genuineness, compassion and warmth are needed for this job
Interview Questions: Scenarios about high stress situations and which you respond to first.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview consists of a presentation and writing prompt after a series of questions. It is generally about an hour long process. The response time can be a bit lengthy
Interview Questions: How would you recruit a student from Chicago vs the suburbs?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an interview request 3-4 weeks later.  It was a three person individual  interview, total time about an hour. Pretty straight forward, no trick questions just review of qualifications. I received an offer about a week later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience?

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted a few weeks after applying, had a phone interview a few days after that (about 45 minutes with the search committee). Did not come in for an interview for another month after that. Had to put together a presentation, which was presented in front of about 20 library staff. There were a couple of interviews with individuals, but also interviews with groups. The interview lasted a little over a half day and included lunch with staff. Received a personalized rejection a month later.
Interview Questions: How would you build relationships with faculty?

title: Designated School Official Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very quick interview process, there was a committee that lead me through the process which included a couple interviews and a phone interview. The directors were all very kind and informative of the process, and answered all questions I had in a timely matter. I went trough the whole process in less than a month.
Interview Questions: What roles have you had in the international community?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: One written test and 2 technical rounds. Initial written with testing SQL, queries  database design and linux commands. Followed by a technical interview round. Then finally shortlisted 3 candidates for the final interview. Chose 2 candidates.
Interview Questions: Database design, report generation using python

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview . asked basic questions about programming like C , C++ ,  java . Was fun . Interview was friendly . you might get one or two tough questions . Also be confident . thats the key
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ? Hobbies etc

title: College Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with multiple people. Give a presentation on whatever you want. Then meet with the head of the admissions for a tour around the building. He talks to you about whats going on and what you need to do.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a college recruiter

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Whole process took 3-4 months. Submitted resume. Had a phone interview. Was asked to come in for an in-person interview with the team about a week later. A week after that, came in for an interview with PI.  Received an offer shortly thereafter. However, start date kept being pushed out. Eentually, PI asked me to "volunteer" before my official start date. Being unemployed at the time, I agree. Basically worked for free for a month before I officially began. In retrospect, super predatory. Was a red flag for what was to come.
Interview Questions: Asked numerous standard interview questions by a panel of 4 people with whom I'd be working. Then asked more detailed questions about research and the patient populations I'd be working with. e.g. Asked to explain my understanding of MDD and other diagnoses

title: Junior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position online. Later, was offered an interview with the Associate Director. The process took about 3-4 weeks.  Further, I was called for a second interview where they gave me an offer right away.
Interview Questions: Difference between Angel Investors and Venture Capitalists

title: Usher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview, no need for dress clothes. Laid back interview for students attending UIC. Great first job with no prior experience needed. A tour of the location while the interview is taking place.
Interview Questions: What is your schedule like?

title: Administrative Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Peoria, IL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: A group of individuals including faculty and staff interview you at one time.  It was very casual with the normal set of questions asked at interviews.  The faculty and staff that interviewed me were not highly experienced at interviewing.  It was a very easy interview.
Interview Questions: If I could name one, what would my something that I needed to improve.

title: Web Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
-Phone interview (with the development team)
-Onsite interview ( 10-12 coding questions testing the basic coding knowledge)
-Social interview with the entire IT systems team (12 folks) with behavioral and how do you handle particular situation kind of questions
Interview Questions: Javascript and MySQL join questions

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: 2 Physicians interviewed me for about an hour. Very relaxed. They called to set up the interview after a few weeks of having my CV. I felt right at home.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty straightforward. It was a face to face interview with my manager at the department where I interview. The interviewer was very polite and asked behavioral questions and resume-related questions to learn more about my background. The existing colleagues were very welcoming.
Interview Questions: It was a face to face interview with my manager at the department where I interview. The interviewer was very polite and asked behavioral questions and resume-related questions to learn more about my background. He asked me more about database management and web designing and resume-related questions to learn more about my background.

title: Development Officer- Assistant Director of Participation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: This was the worst interview experience I've ever had. I arrive about 10 minutes early & had to go find and office in in the building. Knocked on the door and was told the interview didn't start till 9:30 and was send to wait in the cafe in the lobby 20 some floors below. I looked at my phone as I got in the elevator...it was 9:23. And this was the HR professional I was meeting with. Then I was walked across campus to meet with someone who was waiting for us in the building we had already been in and had to come all the way back. I could tell from the beginning that they already knew who they were hiring and I was not even in contention. One lady didn't even bring questions to ask me. Overall it was extremely unorganized. I would not interview for a development position here again if paired up with the same HR woman and annual giving team. Over all I am glad they didn't offer me the position because I did not like the job that much and I would have taken it just to be able to move to Chicago.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience using and pulling data?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer usually ask very specific job related questions and they sometimes ask you to do a demonstration or presentation of what you have done and capable of. And they will ask you about the time commitment.
Interview Questions: How do you rate your Excel skill level?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: questions on basic knowledge of course related material. Must show sufficiency in topic. They usually hire if you got an A. Much less likely if you got a B or lower.
Interview Questions: How well did you do in related course.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2016

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was extremely long.  It took over 6 months to complete the process.   I got called back for multiple interviews and had to wait months to hear back from them.  It got to the point that I no longer wanted the job.
Interview Questions: Give me a time you made critical decisions?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: a face to face interview was conducted with a group of 4 members and for one position and then we introduced ourselves and described about their clinical research trials and what they will be doing and it went on then asked me couple of questions and the process went on for 1hr
Interview Questions: tel me about yoursef

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Coding and in person, 7 on 1 interview panel. Focus on coding languages and SQL skills. Languages to be known, Python, PHP, Java and familiarity with Oracle and MySql , skilled in SQL and PLSQL scripts
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy. Simple questions about your job history as well as your background in engineering. As long as you can relate and talk normally then it will be easy. I heard back from them a week later after doing the interview.
Interview Questions: Are you used to heavy labor?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I presented my previous work that fit with the current researcher UIC was focusing on. 
There were all the lab's people and the PI and few other collaborators. 
Because at that moment I was not resident in Chicago, they kindly booked a hotel in dowtown. Then I was welcomed by a PhD candidate with who I  had breakfast before my presentation to the rest of the group. 
I presented my own research projects before lunch at the laboratory I applied for the position of Post doc.
Interview Questions: Technical questions relative to my previous work and research.

title: Histology Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a very lengthy process. This is a State Job so approval from a number of offices is needed. I actually interviewed twice. The first time I met when 5 different departments. the 2nd time, i met with an additional person. I then waited some months.
Interview Questions: just regular questions were asked

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I had sent a mail of interest to the professor. He asked to come and meet in him person.The professor interviewed me for 30 minutes. Discussed my work and their work and the collaboration that we could make. It would be simpler if you meet in person than in emails. Better chances of getting employed if you have a working visa (J-1 or J-2 or H-1).
Asked me to volunteer for some time in order to analyze my skills and applicability of my profile in their lab. After I was able to successfully complete a particular task provided to me, I was told that I had passed the interview test and that he would be glad to offer me a position. 
Overall experience was good and I felt confident throughout the interview process
Interview Questions: How do you think we can benefit by employing you?

title: Sales Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was good. The manager wanted to know test my knowledge on the electronic products used in retail and in general my knowledge on computers. It was not too hard to crack.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between RAM and ROM ?

title: Library Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago
Interview Descriptions: It was short and simple. It did not take too long and was not too strenuous. Discussed about the job description and duties and whether I would be able to perform them well or not. I recommend applying for it and it will be a very good experience.
Interview Questions: Discussed about previous experience which was relevant to the position.

title: Human Resources Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with the head of dept., associate head of department, finance manager and director of the writing program.  General interview questions were asked along with details surrounding my background and experience.
Interview Questions: What interested me about this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: discussed about past relevant experiences...and the role i was being offered...i was told about organisational structure as well...it took 3-4 weeks to get me on board with the HR process.
Interview Questions: What are your technical skills that can be used for our dept?

title: Registered Nurse- Mother/Baby Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: First interview with manager of the floor. Very simple, basic questions. Second interview- panel interview with the nurses on the floor. More difficult behavioral type questions that need specific examples.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you needed to be flexible?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online, had a short phone screen (about the job, nothing was asked about me), and an in-person interview. 

Was asked for references, didn't get a response when they said (multiple times) I'd have one by. (This university has a habit of not giving responses, just send a polite email with an answer!)
Interview Questions: No questions about me were asked--nothing about education, experience, or skills. Questions were behavioral based regarding the school values.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Actually, there is no such interview thing. If you are seeking a doctor degree, and getting the assistantship as a TA.  The department will email the contract for you. And you just sign up the contract.
Interview Questions: How to deal with some special situations when being a TA .

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: it was straight forward. I was asked a few questions related to the research study. I was asked why i was interested in the position and how skills I am bringing to the table. I was also asked about my technical background and how it relates to the research study

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was very structured and well organized. Once my application was reviewed, I was notified that my credentials had been qualified and that I had been selected to participate in the interview process.  The interview process consisted of three steps which included two in-person interviews.  The  interviews were well organized and directly addressed the position, required skills to be successful in the role and provided me the opportunity to address each point with detailed description of how my qualifications matched the needs of the position.  Upon completion of the interview process I was quickly notified that I had been selected for the position, offer extended and onboarding was completed.
Interview Questions: I was well prepared for the interview, so I did not find the questions difficult and none that were a unexpected.  The interview was a behavior interview and the questions directly related to the position.  They required me to relate my work history; where I had experienced a similar given scenario, describe the scenario and then how I addressed the situation and what was the outcome. They also would ask if faced with a similar situation would I change the way I addressed it, and if so why.

title: Communication Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: You must apply online.  Each department interviews differently so I'm not sure who or where you will interview with.  I would say that all the questions are standard.  What they are really looking for is having real experience in social media (not the personal type either).  It seems like whoever does their social media is really inept...all of it so it's easy to get in in any department and wow them.  They have no idea about engagement, transparency, disintermediation, word of mouth, inbound marketing, etc so if you know these subjects well, you will be considered.  They are looking for people with experience in campaigns and they do look for your ability to work under pressure, by yourself with little management and those that have initiative.  They do want you to follow their rules (there are so many!) so you do have to work well with others in a team at times.  You will get an email from HR stating that you have been considered but have to come in to complete forms.  They will email several documents for you to fill out and turn in online first which include background checks, statements from previous employers, identifications, transcripts, etc.  After that, they schedule an appointment and they gather all your forms and sit with you in front of a terminal to set up your accounts but get ready for the many etical forms you must sign.
Interview Questions: None were difficult.  The scenarios were freshman in nature.  If you had a couple years of experience, you can quickly answer their questions like what would you do to promote an initiative to get students involved.  I said put kittens and puppies in all marketing and advertising (as a joke).

Manager described the basic expectations of the job and some of the requirements for working there.
