Interview Questions: What would you do if you were working if someone walked past you without showing keys and ID?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was called an "open house" where potential candidates are all brought in. In pairs of two perspective students, three interviews with professors are held. The topic of conversation ranged from previous project history to asking how they could persuade us to join their program. There was a campus tour and a trip to Starbucks. The professors all gave 15 minute small talks to explain their work.
Interview Questions: Why did you decide to do project X, and since you did project X, why do you want to join our program?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview for 20 minutes, only simple questions about what did you do in your Ph.D period, why do you choose this lab, what kind of project do you want to do in this lab, and then introduce themselves.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Recruitment Day Events: Dinner the night before was included. There was a series of 30 minute interviews throughout the day with different program leaders and advisers. There was time to mingle with current students over meals and between interviews. It was an exhausting day.
Interview Questions: What do you want to research?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: There are 2 interviews, an individual and a group interview.  The individual interview is done with a current staff member and their supervisor (usually a SRA, SPM, or RD). The group interview is done in 3 parts.  You are placed in groups of 8-12 and given 3 different tasks.  A group of staff members are assigned to watch 1-3 of the interviewees and record their contributions.  Each of these interviews are given a score and placed into a computer to rank people.
Interview Questions: Group interviews ask easy tasks like putting a list of 8 residents in order of most likely to cause trouble to least likely.  It becomes difficult to work together to accomplish group interview tasks.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: This position was hired internally. So the interview process was relatively quick and friendly with only few people, but I heard also from other processes with a regular 3 day interview process. Overall very friendly and easy process.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: It took us forever to schedule the phone interview because my emails kept going into the spam. But after the time scheduled, the interview was relatively with only basic questions. I got the offer a few days after the phone interview.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous research experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: 1 to 1 interview, asking questions about past experience, interested field, future career plan. process was straight forward.this space needs more word so more words and words. and more word and more words and more words needed for thsi space.
Interview Questions: 1 to 1 interview, asking questions about past experience, interested field, future career plan

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very simple.  Went through the student employment office.  They sent you emails about people who were hiring.  You send those people your resume and they will interview you separately .
Interview Questions: All questions were simple behavioral questions.  Nothing shocking.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of back ground detail discussion especially the relevant projects done
Interview Questions: Salary expected?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: You better find a professor before applying to this univ. Dept. decide whom to accept. The rest of the paper work is just formality and usually if you are lucky it will go smoothly.  Find a person with research which intrest you. Be prepared and dress neatly. Smile and avoid contrivertial topics and politics of their work envierment. Although in some depts it's important to start with the most influentional people and avoid some people.
Interview Questions: It deppendet on the advissor. They are deffintly looking for people who enthusiast about their research topics.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a phone interview shortly after I applied.. I did a phone interview, then a group interview, then a one on one interview.  After my phone interview they checked all of my references without letting me know before the called me to do the on campus interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: My hiring experience was good. I had the interview and the next week I was notified about the postion. I was not rush or push to take the position. I was able to start like about two weeks later.
Interview Questions: How would I get back and fourth to work, or do I have small children.

title: Groundsworker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: On the first day of interviews, you are asked mainly ethics questions. They are testing whether or not you are prepared to work effectively and efficiently on your own as well as with a partner. The main bulk of work is done remotely and away from management, so one must be diligent with their own work ethic
Interview Questions: Will you be able to work weekends

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Had a friend referring me to the position, received an phone interview from the P.I. after sending my resume, met with him the next day and received the offer within a week
Interview Questions: Details of my previous projects

title: Visiting Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was easy.  The primary investigator invited me to interview, and scheduled for a convenient time. After our interview, he gave me a tour of the facility, introduced me to team members, and took time to answer my questions. The HR liaison for the department very kindly took care of numerous administrative tasks for me such as scheduling employee orientation.  Benefits were easy to set up, as it is a guided online process.
Interview Questions: "Tell me what you know about research methods."

title: Senior Associate Director of DOnor Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: There's been a hiring freeze here forever.  They get around it by bringing in "visiting" specialists who can then become full employees.
Interview Questions: I really didn't interview for this position.  I was moving to Chicago and needed a job.  I got in touch with a connection from the job I had left who brought me in as a "visitor."  After nine months, I got a token offer for another job and they quickly removed my visiting status.

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions:
•	Coordinate with student employees with professional staff members.  
•	Lead and assisted in group projects to open up new Service Centers and generated new attractions through marketing towards UIC community 
•	Communicates to campus union’s operations professional staff all situations building repairs and maintenance needed, and complaints from patrons.
•	Performs public relations functions for special events by greeting arrangements chairperson at the beginning of an event 
•	Trained new Building Managers
Interview Questions: Can you handle the pressure?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is informal but well managed and candidates are well taken care of by the university and the search committee.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself contributing to the research growth at the university.

title: Director of Development for A College Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very Thorough process, interested panel - tough questions but appropriate.
Interview Questions: Give a solicitation pitch

title: Word Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: Had to sumit my application.  Then they chose the candidates who were qualified to come in and take a civil service test and typing test.  The top three test scorers were interviewed.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our organization?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple chat to see if the skills matched with the requirements
Interview Questions: How well do you know programming

title: Department Add Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Illinois at Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: I got a call one day. then they called me for personal intw. I went and they asked me questions about matlab image processing. I talks about my previous experience and software coding projects.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the segmentaion process  in Image processing.
